All Games > Action Games > BrainBread 2
Community Hub
BrainBread 2
Grab a weapon, demolish your enemies, level up, become more powerful, let the gore flow, let the limbs fly. BrainBread 2 introduces a zombie fps mixed with RPG / Arcade elements, the game is very action-packed and generally fast-paced.

Title: BrainBread 2
Genre: Action, Adventure, Free to Play, Indie, Early Access
Developer: Reperio Studios
Publisher: Reperio Studios
Release Date: Jul 20, 2016

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“BrainBread 2 has been under development for quite some time, the game still has some placeholders, we're a small team which means that some things will take more time than others. So far the game is playable and we want to share our current content with the public in order to develop a stronger community and gain good feedback so we can polish the game as much as possible before full release.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“It's currently difficult to say how long BrainBread 2 will stay in Early Access.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“Additional game mode(s), more weapons, new npcs, more levels for each game mode, a complete story line and more survivors to choose from.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“The game is very stable, we have 5 unique game modes available, lots of different npcs and playable characters, over one hour long soundtrack, leaderboards and a unique skill system which is saved via Steam Stats.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“BrainBread 2 will still be Free To Play after Early Access.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“As improvements are implemented occasionally, an opt in beta branch (Windows only) will be used for bug reporting / feedback from the community, this will help us fix any issues / problems before new updates goes into the public branch.”

July 20

BrainBread 2 will go live in a few minutes!

BrainBread 2 will now go live in a matter of minutes, a few hours earlier than expected!

We've also pushed a minor update, server owners please update your servers!

  • Fixed some exploits in bbc_termoil & bba_colosseum.
  • Fixed soundlevels on some soundscripts.
  • The tutorial narrator's volume has been fixed up.

65 comments Read more

July 19

BrainBread 2 Dedicated Server - AppID 475370 [RELEASED]

The dedicated server tool should now be available for everyone!

DISCLAIMER
If you are having issues on Windows using SteamCMD, be sure to remove these lines from the brainbread2/gameinfo.txt file:

game+mod |gameinfo_path|../../../workshop/content/346330/*
game+mod |gameinfo_path|../../steamapps/workshop/content/346330/*

Be aware that some Linux distros using an outdated version of libcurl will not be able to host servers for BrainBread 2, libcurl is the core piece in our custom tag and ban system. (BB2 uses v7.31+)

2 comments Read more

Report bugs and leave feedback for this game on the discussion boards

About This Game

CyberCon, the notorious global corporation, aspired to deliver to the world something that would change the fate of humanity. What the world wasn't ready for however... Was CyberCon's true intentions. Their schemes had been controversial to most before, but their newest idea seemed almost too perfect.
A much sinister secret was about to be exposed. CyberCon's project involved the development of neuro-hub chips. They succeeded and became a phenomenon, later becoming a mandatory law to have them implanted at birth using state of the art surgery and cutting edge technology.

CyberCon were granted this permission from the government. The controversy was covered up and very little was known how it was done.
The technology was seen by many around the world as a major breakthrough that could cure blindness, deafness, disease, and a huge boost in performance for modern day life.

It was further aiding as a gateway to easier communication and enhanced capabilities. This was the next milestone in human history.
However, good things must always come to an end.

And CyberCon's true colors are yet to be revealed.

Features

  • 5 Unique gamemodes.
  • Over 20 unique weapons, including akimbo weapons!
  • Extreme amounts of gore & gibbing, this is your lovely grindhouse-gore movie!
  • Over 100 unique skill combinations.
  • A global profile system/leveling system.
  • Play as a zombie, evolve as a zombie using your special zombie skill tree to your advantage!
  • Modding friendly, customize your own soundsets for any of the npcs, make your own player survivor models, make custom maps, share your creations via Workshop!
  • Character customization.
  • No pay to win!
  • Simple UI and HUD.
  • AI Soldiers, Tanks and Bandits/Mercenaries.
  • A powerful quest, objective & inventory system.
  • Playable on PC, Mac OSX, and Linux with multiplayer cross-compatibility.
  • Dedicated Server Support for PC and Linux.

Gamemodes

  • Story
    Focuses on story based gameplay, progress by doing specific quests or side-quests to increase your chance of survival!

  • Objective
    Focuses on small & simple objectives, this is a casual/chill gamemode based on the original BrainBread, if you want a pure BrainBread experience you can enable a server command to force it to vanilla BrainBread mode. In this mode you can also play as a zombie and as a human you can get infected. The zombie's objective is to prevent the humans from progressing, when you get a certain amount of kills you will be able to respawn as a human again, or if you die too many times. All of this can be regulated by the server owner.

  • Arena
    This is a wave based gamemode, similar to 'Survival'. You have limited respawns and when you die you'll respawn after X amount of seconds. Everyone respawns at the same time, certain maps may allow certain amount of retries for a wave, if you fail too many times you have to do everything over again. This mode is very action-packed, you better be flexible.

  • Elimination
    A Humans VS Zombies gamemode, first team to reach the fraglimit wins! In this mode you respawn individually, however if everyone on your team is dead your team will be 'Exterminated', which means the round is over. The opposite team gains a certain amount of points by exterminating the other team, this is an effective way to gain points but it is hard to achieve if there's many players. In this mode you'll also trigger a team perk if your team gets a certain amount of kills, your team will be blessed with some helpful skill for a certain amount of seconds.

  • Deathmatch
    A PvP gamemode, solely for humans. Featuring classic old-school powerups, increased speed and flexibility! As well as an announcer which will try to salute you or make fun of you if you fail too much!

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
SteamOS + Linux
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8/10
    • Processor: 1.7 GHz processor or equivalent
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: ATI Radeon 9600 or Nvidia GeForce 500 series

    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Storage: 6 GB available space
    • Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible sound

Early Access Review
Posted: July 20
This game is a â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥torm to say the least. Objective maps dont tell you where to go whilst arena is everyone on an unreachable platform shooting zombies and PVP is just a bunch of people BHopping and spamming hoping to get a kill, elimination is a clusterâ¥â¥â¥â¥ as the spawn system is awful.

Playing as the zombie is the most overpowered thing imaginable as you kill people in 3 hits and take a â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥on of hits to die, it gets to the point where you kill 30 people before you die.

I met a developer ingame who did nothing but brag about the sounds he ripped off of other games and ignored any complaints about the game or gave a childish vague answer and according to a mutual friend of mine the lead developer is "a â¥â¥â¥â¥" (take this as you will).

The maps and spawn system are unnatural as the maps are untraversable as no direction is given to the player while the spawn system is god awful as zombies spawn inside you or leave invisible walls where they spawn blocking you from moving. It's worse when the player controlled zombies just spawn camp you as you dont spawn with a weapon.

The melee system is a joke since left click just slaps the zombies for insignificant damage while right click spends 3 seconds charging an attack which always goes through the zombies. Also everytime you go into the melee range of your weapon the zombie has already hit you for a third of your health.

The guns in this game are designed poorly as well as the accuracy of them is utter garbage and it's impossible to hit anything moving sideways, getting ammo is impossible as it's either hidden or placed in a meatgrinder of zombies. Another annoyance is that theres a cooldown to picking up guns which is a travesty when you cant get any ammo. A developer said this was to "stop camping" when players could instead camp near ammo but whatever.
In addition, you need to be a certain level to use weapons which is utterly pointless and makes no sense as it will kill the playerbase. Making your game a grind on every server will kill attendance and make only a few servers actually playable for people in the forseeable future.

Also NPC's and players block hits which is extremely aggravating when you're trying to kill a human as a zombie.

Your level doesnt get transfered to different servers even though a dev told me that it does, this means that you either play to stay on a server or keep joining the same one. I'm going to predict that this game lasts a few months before it turns into a â¥â¥â¥â¥ing mess of people running 50MPH whilst jumping incredible distances, one shotting everything.

It may seem this game has a lot of content, but it's all a ruse since it's all just gimmicks such as the character customisation (oh wow, 3 head and skin types), xp system which just increases statistics and doesnt add anything to the actual gameplay, the military NPC's stay in the same spot while the bandits move around aimlessly. the flashlight is completely worthless and randomly switches itself off.

Now before you downvote this review just because it's negative, remember that developers need negative reviews for feedback on how to improve their game. They also let people know if a game is worth getting or not since most positive reviews barely even describe the game and just say stupid â¥â¥â¥â¥ like "i kicked a zombie's torso and it's limbs flied off, 10/10", which is pretty awesome but gives you no information whatsoever.
Also dont be the â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ who reminds me that it's "early access", it's not an excuse for a poor game when it's been in development for a year and a half and will probably stay in early access for the rest of it's days.

Early Access Review
Posted: July 20
So i got access to the beta of this game and i think i played enough so i can write a review for this game!The game just realesed on steam with Early Access so it's understandable that this game will have some bug's and glitches

Let's get a look at the PROS and CONS
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROS
-The graphics are decent so any poor PC can handle it
-The gameplay feals good
-The reload anymation on some of the guns are amazing that they make you feal like an badass
-It has some cool and hard gamemodes
-Playing it solo will make it a challenge
-It has skills that you can upgrade buy leveling up
-And it's very funny to play with friends
-It has Workshop-Achievements-Character Customization
-No Shop or P2W stuff ( not now )
-You can get better guns and lvl's in a server just by killing zombies!!
-The difficulty changes by the fact of how many people are in the server
-IT HAS A FREAKING MINIGUN,SLAY THEM DADDY
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONS
-As i said there is Bugs and glitches because it just realesed as Early Access
-You need to still crouch jump even in small objectives
-The Slide it's buggy ( im sure they will fix it )
-The Bandids NPC'S do too much damage ( maybe they will change that )
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I will recomend this game to anyone that likes kind of a fast-pased game and zombies,or wants a game to mess around and have fun with friends!The developers are really friendly and they are trying to make this game as good as possible!

IF YOU DINT TRIED THE GAME DO IT NOW,IT'S FREE!
10/10

Please people give this game the love that it needs,it's really awesome!Im sure that the devs will add more guns-zombies in the game and more amazing content! :)


Thanks for reading my review-Have a nice day-night
Sorry if any gramatical mistakes!
